text:
I dunno why everybody's dogging on the lyrics, I like they way they're unique and creates these images in your mind.
"Once it was a coal pit but now it's a water ride".
"I'm in narrow hallways. running like it's a ballgame"? That line describes my busy school life so perfectly, in fact I think that line whenever I'm rushing from class to class on the campus, lol.

author: TheHarmonixer

text: I consider Sonic Adventure 2 the last reasonably good Sonic game. It was flawed in some important ways, but it was still worth playing. The soundtrack on the game was very good (Live and Learn, anyone?). In fact, about the only thing about recent Sonic titles that I would say has been consistently good is the music.

text: I feel like the Sonic Adventure games get dismissed too often for being just another 3D sonic game. Honestly, I thought they were pretty damn good, especially for the time (I've gone back and played SA1 and 2, and I will say that 2 has aged better than SA1...). I also did always like the chill hip-hop beats that the knuckles levels got.

author: airburst1

text:
SA I preferred the gameplay.
And while I like a lot of the soundtracks, I find it hard to argue with SA2 having the best, if not one of the best Sonic soundtracks. City Escape, Metal Harbor, Radical Highway, Eggman's theme, Pumpkin Hill, Aquatic Mine, Meteor Herd, the one that against the BioLizard, Live & Learn are my favs.

text: Well this one's a guilty pleasure.
